title: Helm Schema config file
description: JSON Schema for the "helm schema" plugin, allowing you to set configs using a config file instead of using command-line flags. The default file name used by "helm schema" is ".schema.yaml".

bundle.description: Bundle referenced ($ref) subschemas into a single file inside $defs.

bundleRoot.description: Root directory to allow local referenced files to be loaded from. Defaults to the current working directory.

bundleWithoutID.description: Bundle without using $id to reference bundled schemas, which improves compatibility with e.g the VS Code JSON extension.

k8sSchemaURL.description: URL template used in "$ref: $k8s/..." alias. Uses Go text templating, where "{{ .K8sSchemaVersion }}" maps to the k8sSchemaVersion config.

k8sSchemaVersion.description: Version used in the "k8sSchemaURL" template for "$ref: $k8s/..." alias. This setting has no default value and must be set in order to use the "$k8s" alias.

noAdditionalProperties.description: Default additionalProperties to false for all objects in the schema.

noDefaultGlobal.description: Disable automatic injection of 'global' property when schema root does not allow it.

schemaRoot.description: Set of configs for configuring properties on the output root schema.

additionalProperties.description: JSON Schema "additionalProperties" on the output schema root. This has precedence over the "noAdditionalProperties" config.

description.description: JSON Schema "description" on the output schema root.

id.description: JSON Schema "$id" on the output schema root.

ref.description: JSON Schema "$ref" on the output schema root. When using local file references (e.g "./foobar.json") the path is relative to your .schema.yaml config file.

title.description: JSON Schema "title" on the output schema root.

values.description: One or more YAML files as inputs.
